div.p: SARGUS, in ichthyology. See Sparus. SARIMPATAM, a country of Indoſtan, lying at the back of the dominions of the Samorin of Malabar, and which, as far as we know, was never ſubdued by any foreign power. Mr Groſe relates, that “it has been conſtantly a maxim with the inhabitants of this country never to make any but a defenſive war; and even then, not to kill any of their adverſaries in battle, but to cut off their noſes. To this ſervice the military were peculiarly trained up, and the dread of the deformity proved ſufficiently ſtrong to keep their neighbours, not much more martial than themſelves, from effectually attacking them. ”
